meanings.definition: Someone who is faithful or devoted to a person, cause, or duty.
meanings.sent1: My dog is the loyaler in our family, always by my side.
meanings.sent2: The loyaler of the two friends never betrayed their trust.
meanings.sent3: The loyaler cat in the house always greets us at the door with a meow.
meanings.sent4: The loyaler of the two siblings was like a guardian angel, watching over the younger one.
meanings.sent5: The loyaler employee always stayed late to finish tasks, earning respect from colleagues.

meanings.definition: More faithful or devoted than someone else.
meanings.sent1: She was the loyaler friend, always there when needed.
meanings.sent2: The loyaler dog never strayed far from its owner's side.
meanings.sent3: The loyaler student in the class always had their hand raised to answer questions.
meanings.sent4: The loyaler tree in the forest stood tall and strong, providing shade for all.
meanings.sent5: The loyaler fan cheered the loudest at every game, showing unwavering support.
